greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ways of writing n as a sum of 9 squares.
reference: E. Grosswald, Representations of Integers as Sums of Squares. Springer-Verlag, NY, 1985, p. 121.
G. H. Hardy and E. M. Wright, An Introduction to the Theory of Numbers. 3rd ed., Oxford Univ. Press, 1954, p. 314.
Lomadze, G.A.: On the representations of natural numbers by sums of nine squares. Acta. Arith. 68(3), 245-253 (1994). (Russian).  See Equation (3.6).
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Shi-Chao Chen, Congruences for rs(n), Journal of Number Theory, Volume 130, Issue 9, September 2010, Pages 2028-2032.
S. C. Milne, Infinite families of exact sums of squares formulas, Jacobi elliptic functions, continued fractions and Schur functions, Ramanujan J., 6 (2002), 7-149.
M. Peters, Sums of nine squares, Acta Arith., 102 (2002), 131-135.
Index entries for sequences related to sums of squares
formula: G.f.: theta_3(0,q)^9, where theta_3 is the 3rd Jacobi theta function. - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Jan 13 2017
maple: A008452list := proc(len) series(JacobiTheta3(0, x)^9, x, len+1);
seq(coeff(%, x, j), j=0..len-1) end: A008452list(32); # _Peter Luschny_, Oct 02 2018
xref: Row d=9 of A122141 and of A319574, 9th column of A286815.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
